Ensemble Componentsïƒ

This section documents the ensemble-building components used by pyensemblefs to combine feature-selection methods, bootstrap resampling and aggregation strategies.

The ensemble pipelineïƒ

The ensemble workflow in pyensemblefs follows a simple but highly modular structure:

â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
â”‚  Bootstrapper    â”‚  â†’  produces a (B Ã— p) matrix
â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜      of scores / ranks / masks
           â”‚
           â–¼
â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
â”‚    Aggregator    â”‚  â†’  combines bootstrap results
â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜      into final ranking/scores
           â”‚
           â–¼
â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
â”‚ EnsembleFeatureSelector     â”‚
â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
           â”‚
           â–¼
Selected feature subset

Homogeneous vs heterogeneous ensemblesïƒ

pyensemblefs supports two ensemble regimes, depending on how feature selectors are used across bootstrap resamples:

  • Homogeneous ensembles â€“ a single base selector is applied on every bootstrap resample.

  • Heterogeneous ensembles â€“ multiple base selectors are distributed across resamples (sequentially or at random), promoting diversity.

Homogeneous ensembles (Bootstrapper)ïƒ

In the homogeneous case, the same feature selector \(f\) is applied to each of the \(B\) bootstrap resamples:

Data (X, y)
     â”‚
     â”œâ”€ bootstrap #1 â”€â”€â–º  f  â”€â”€â–º  resultâ‚
     â”œâ”€ bootstrap #2 â”€â”€â–º  f  â”€â”€â–º  resultâ‚‚
     â”œâ”€   ...
     â””â”€ bootstrap #B â”€â”€â–º  f  â”€â”€â–º  result_B

results_  â†’  stacked into a matrix R âˆˆ â„^{BÃ—p}
              (scores / ranks / binary supports)

R  â†’  Aggregator  â†’  final scores / ranks / mask

This is implemented by pyensemblefs.ensemble.bootstrapper.Bootstrapper, which:

  • draws \(B\) bootstrap resamples of \((X, y)\),

  • fits the same selector on each resample,

  • collects outputs into a matrix results_ of shape (B, p).

Heterogeneous ensembles (MetaBootstrapper)ïƒ

In the heterogeneous case, a collection of base selectors \(ğ”½ = {fâ‚, â€¦, f_M}\) is used and distributed across bootstrap resamples according to a scheduling strategy:

Data (X, y)
     â”‚
     â”œâ”€ bootstrap #1 â”€â”€â–º  fâ‚  â”€â”€â–º  resultâ‚
     â”œâ”€ bootstrap #2 â”€â”€â–º  fâ‚‚  â”€â”€â–º  resultâ‚‚
     â”œâ”€ bootstrap #3 â”€â”€â–º  fâ‚ƒ  â”€â”€â–º  resultâ‚ƒ
     â”œâ”€   ...
     â””â”€ bootstrap #B â”€â”€â–º  f_{Ïƒ(B)} â”€â”€â–º  result_B

where Ïƒ(b) encodes the scheduling strategy:
  â€¢ sequential  â†’ fâ‚, fâ‚‚, â€¦, f_M, fâ‚, â€¦
  â€¢ random      â†’ f_{Ïƒ(b)} ~ Uniform(ğ”½)
  â€¢ random_weighted â†’ f_{Ïƒ(b)} ~ Weighted(ğ”½)

The heterogeneous logic is implemented by pyensemblefs.ensemble.metabootstrapper.MetaBootstrapper, which:

  • receives a list of base selectors (filters or model-based),

  • distributes them over bootstrap resamples according to a chosen strategy,

  • builds three matrices when applicable:

    • results_ â€“ binary supports (subset outputs),

    • score_mat_ â€“ stacked score vectors,

    • rank_mat_ â€“ stacked rank vectors,

  • records the method used at each resample in methods_used_.

These matrices are then passed to aggregation and stability modules to quantify consensus and robustness across heterogeneous FS strategies.

Modulesïƒ

The following classes implement the components of the ensemble pipeline.

Base Ensemble Componentïƒ

Bootstrapper (homogeneous)ïƒ

The homogeneous bootstrapper applies a single feature-selection method across all bootstrap iterations.

It produces:

  • results_ : array (B, p) Binary selection masks, scores or ranks depending on the selector.

MetaBootstrapper (heterogeneous)ïƒ

The heterogeneous bootstrapper cycles or samples from multiple feature selectors, supporting strategies:

  • sequential

  • random

  • random_weighted

It produces:

  • results_ : (B, p) binary masks

  • score_mat_ : (B_s, p) stacked score vectors

  • rank_mat_ : (B_r, p) stacked ranking vectors

  • methods_used_ : list of selector names used per bootstrap

EnsembleFeatureSelectorïƒ

This is the â€œglueâ€ component that receives a bootstrapper and an aggregator, producing a final ordered list of feature indices.

It supports:

  • ranking-based aggregators

  • score-based aggregators

  • binary input aggregators

Minimal exampleïƒ

from sklearn.datasets import load_breast_cancer
from sklearn.feature_selection import SelectKBest, f_classif

from pyensemblefs.ensemble.bootstrapper import Bootstrapper
from pyensemblefs.ensemble.featureselector import EnsembleFeatureSelector
from pyensemblefs.aggregators.rank import BordaFromRanksAggregator

X, y = load_breast_cancer(return_X_y=True)

base_fs = SelectKBest(score_func=f_classif, k=10)
bootstrapper = Bootstrapper(fs_method=base_fs, n_bootstraps=30)

aggregator = BordaFromRanksAggregator()

selector = EnsembleFeatureSelector(
    bootstrapper=bootstrapper,
    aggregator=aggregator,
    k=10,
)

selector.fit(X, y)
print(selector.selected_indices_)
